The `GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS` environment variable is used to specify the path to the JSON key file for the Google DNS API. It is necessary for the Certbot command to authenticate with the Google DNS API and obtain or renew the TLS certificates.

Regarding the cron job, you can add the following line to the `renew-cert.sh` script to schedule the renewal to run at 3:15 am every day:
```javascript
15 3 * * * /path/to/renew-cert.sh >> /var/log/certbot-renew.log 2>&1
```
This line should be added at the end of the script, before the `EOF` line, and it will write the output to `/var/log/certbot-renew.log`. Make sure to replace `/path/to/renew-cert.sh` with the actual path to the script on your server.

Note that in order to set up the cron job, you will need to make the script executable by running `chmod +x /path/to/renew-cert.sh`, and then add the above line to the crontab file by running `crontab -e`.
